business.headline: Using old tax regime? Here's how draft income tax rules 2026 could help you save moreIf you are still using the old income tax regime, the government's draft rules for 2026 may bring some welcome relief. Proposed changes to key exemptions and allowances could slightly lower your tax bill and make the traditional regime more rewarding.

RBI move hits Dalal Street stocks: BSE, Groww fall up to 10%. Here's whyThe selling pressure came after the RBI issued a revised circular on February 13 under its amended RBI (Commercial Banks – Credit Facilities) Directions. The new rules change how banks can lend to entities involved in the capital markets.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as market sentiment remain cautious over IT selloffThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 47.79 points to 82,578.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7.45 points to 25,464.75 as of 9:48 am.

Man paid Rs 50,000 a year premium, insurance claim denied when mother fell illThe man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year for his mother's policy and when she needed treatment, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance, where he alleged he was made to wait for hours. His claim was denied.

Budget without populism and with capital outlays powers growth, jobs: PMDescribing the Budget for the fiscal year starting April 1 as reflective of his governance approach, PM Modi said the document is a good reflection of our governance style and priorities.

Have Rs 5,000? Here's why an emergency fund should come before your SIPYou've heard the advice, i.e., "Start a SIP immediately." But is that the smartest first move with Rs 5,000? The choice might surprise you.

Will AI change how you invest your money in stocks and mutual funds?The next market shift may not come from earnings or interest rates. It may come from AI. In this article, we explore how it could reshape your stock and mutual fund investments.

Air India fined Rs 1 crore for flying Airbus 8 times without airworthiness permitThe DGCA has imposed a fine of about Rs 1 crore on Air India for flying an Airbus aircraft eight times without a valid airworthiness permit. The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Why personalised loans are becoming the go-to option in 2026The journey of hyper-personalisation in personal loans is going to get more exciting for customers with the increasing adoption of technology refining customer offerings, based on minute details of the customers.

RBI plans to update Kisan Credit Card rules : 5 key changes to trackThe Reserve Bank of India is preparing to overhaul the Kisan Credit Card scheme, and the proposed changes could reshape how farmers borrow and repay loans. With the new draft rules on the table, what exactly is set to change for farm credit?

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's market bloodbath?The market opened on a weak note and remained under pressure throughout the session, with losses deepening in the second half. The decline appeared to be driven by profit booking at elevated levels and a cautious mood among investors amid global uncertainties.

Reliance wins US licence for Venezuelan oil as India wavers on Russia supplyReliance applied for the licence in early January as India looks to diversify its energy purchases. Direct purchase of Venezuelan oil will help Reliance replace Russian oil in a cost-effective way.

Cheque bounced? How one mistake can spiral into legal and financial troubleA bounced cheque may seem like a minor slip, but it can quickly trigger penalties, credit damage and even legal complications. What starts as a simple payment error can snowball into a serious financial setback. Are you aware of the risks?

8th Pay Commission: Government seeks public feedback; who can participateThe recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are expected to influence future salary structures, allowances and pension benefits for central government staff.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly: Rise ahead or fall on the cards?After days of volatility, gold and silver have posted modest gains, catching the attention of investors. The small rise has reopened a familiar debate, i.e., are precious metals preparing for another climb, or is a fresh dip still possible?

RBI steps in to stop mis-selling by banks: Decoding what's good and what's not clearThe Reserve Bank of India has signalled its intent after years of rising mis-selling complaints. But will this draft protect ordinary customers before the next grievance is filed? In this article, we break down what changes, what remains unclear, and whether enforcement can finally make a difference.

65-10-10-15 rule: How a 4-asset 'boring thali' portfolio helps in uncertain marketsWhen markets feel uncertain and investors struggle to decide where to put their money, a simple multi-asset strategy is drawing attention. Instead of chasing trends, the 65-10-10-15 "boring thali" approach focusses on balance and steady investing.

Is it the end of the road for silver after a spectacular rally?After a stunning rally and an equally sharp fall, silver now sits at a crucial crossroads, leaving investors wondering whether this correction is nearing its end or still gathering momentum.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 3:16 pm, the Sensex was down 1055.91 points to 82,619.01, while the Nifty stood at 25,481.35, lower by 325.85 points. The fall was led by heavy selling in IT stocks, but the triggers lie largely in global developments.

TCS, Infosys sink nearly 6%: 3 reasons why IT stocks are falling againShares of TCS and Infosys fell nearly 6% in early trade, dragging the Nifty IT index lower. The weakness was not driven by any one company-specific announcement. Instead, it reflects a mix of global triggers and rising uncertainty around how artificial intelligence will reshape the industry.

entertainment.headline: Why Raveena Tandon called Yami Gautam to apologise after watching Dhurandhar Actor Raveena Tandon has expressed her admiration for Aditya Dhar's film Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, which released in December 2025. Tandon was so moved by the film that she contacted actor Yami Gautam and praised her husband's hard work.

Sonu Sood prays for Rajpal Yadav's bail ahead of hearing, calls him a rare talent Sonu Sood showed public support for Rajpal Yadav as the latter faces a crucial bail hearing in the Delhi High Court today. The actor wrote a note on social media following Yadav's conviction in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case.

Abhishek Bachchan shares how daily life inspired his investment in food app Abhishek Bachchan shared that his investments in Naagin Sauce, Swiggy and Zepto were inspired by his personal experiences and daily life.

How Telugu producer Allu Aravind fought for Tamils in 1960s anti-Hindi protests Allu Aravind, renowned Telugu film producer, shared insights on his involvement as a student leader in the 1960s anti-Hindi protests in Tamil Nadu, describing his motivations, actions during the demonstrations, and interactions with political leaders of the era.

Daisy Shah joins Shreyas Talpade in Palaash Muchhal's directorial Palash Muchhal is gearing up to direct a new thriller starring Shreyas Talpade and Daisy Shah. This project marks his professional comeback after his wedding with Smriti Mandhana was called off amid controversy.

Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli keep it classy in white at Mumbai airport. Watch Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were clicked at Mumbai airport with coordinated and understated looks. The two are speculated to have left for London.

Why do National Film Awards ignore casting? The Mukesh Chhabra interview | Part I Why is casting still absent from the National Film Awards? In this multi-interview series, starting with Mukesh Chhabra, India Today reflects on India's casting ecosystem and why recognition now feels overdue. As the industry evolves, we try to turn the spotlight on a category that policymakers may no longer be able to overlook.

Should Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani have a sequel? Ranbir Kapoor has a clear answer Ranbir Kapoor shared updates about his film lineup during a recent Instagram Live session. He clarified that there will be no sequel to Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani while also revealing new timelines for his upcoming films.

Viral: Harper Beckham's Valentine's Day wish for 'best big brothers' amid feud Harper Beckham shared a sweet Valentine's Day messages for her brothers, showing their close bond despite ongoing family tensions. The post has gone viral.

Rashmika, Vijay arrive separately, but leave in same car at Mumbai airport. Watch Actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda, who are at the centre of ongoing wedding rumours, were seen arriving in Mumbai separately but leaving together in the same car. The two are yet to share an official statement.

Eternity: Elizabeth Olsen-Miles Teller unearth enduring bonds, imperfect love David Freyne's Eternity reimagines romance by showing how the raw, resilient threads of lifelong love weave a deeper eternity than any fleeting spark.

Stranger Things' Maya Hawke marries Christian Lee Hutson in Valentine's Day wedding Maya Hawke, Robin Buckley of Stranger Things, got married to musician Christian Lee Hutson at an intimate ceremony in New York City. The couple is yet to share the official photos from the wedding.

Kunickaa showers love on son Ayaan's Battle Of Galwan song, thanks Salman Khan Kunickaa Sadanand shared an emotional note celebrating her son Ayaan Lall's debut song 'Main Hoon' from Salman Khan's upcoming film Battle of Galwan.

Ajay Devgn, Mammootty and celebs react to India thrashing Pakistan in T20 World Cup Ajay Devgn, Mammootty and Paresh Rawal, among others, from the Indian film industry shared reactions online after India's 61-run victory against Pakistan in the ongoing T20 World Cup championship. With this win, India has stormed into the Super 8 stage.

O' Romeo box office Day 3: Shahid Kapoor's biggest film post-Covid, beats TBMAUJ Vishal Bhardwaj's romantic thriller, O' Romeo, starring Shahid Kapoor, collected Rs 30.15 crore nett in its opening weekend. The film emerges as Shahid's biggest post-pandemic opener, beating Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya.

Made India proud: Shashi Tharoor praises Priyanka Chopra after Harvard reunion Shashi Tharoor praised Priyanka Chopra after reconnecting with her at the Harvard India Conference, calling her achievements a matter of pride for India.

Sara Arjun, Tamannaah, Srinidhi Shetty dance their hearts out at Isha centre. Videos Actors Sara Arjun, Tamannaah, Srinidhi Shetty and Mouni Roy attended the Mahashivratri celebrations at Isha Yoga Centre in Coimbatore. The event also saw participation from key political leaders.
Kate Hudson opens up about typecasting and being told she was too old for music Kate Hudson spoke about being typecast in romantic comedies and being told she was "too old" to start a music career.

Badshah shares emotional note after playing at NBA event, calls it dream come true Badshah fulfilled a lifelong dream by stepping onto an NBA court as a player during a celebrity game in the US, calling the moment inspiring and surreal.

general news.headline: Bhupen Borah quits Assam Congress, Himanta Sarma swiftly signals BJP's offerBhupen Kumar Borah reportedly sent his resignation letter to Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, alleging that he was being "ignored" by the party leadership and not given his due within the state unit.

Mohanlal, Kamal Haasan salute parents of Aalin, Kerala's youngest organ donorAalin's parents decided to donate her organs -- including her liver, kidneys, heart valve and corneas -- which were successfully transplanted, helping save the lives of five children across multiple hospitals.

India's big AI moment, PM to host global tech titans at mega summit todayDay 1 will include a leadership session on leveraging AI for the future of learning and work, examining its impact on global employment and skills. Another session will explore how artificial intelligence can transform India's judicial system by improving efficiency, transparency, and accessibility.

A new low: When Pakistan lost to India as early as toss. Over and out.T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Pakistan had little go their way after choosing to bowl first in Colombo, where teams batting second have struggled throughout the tournament. Their decision backfired as Pakistan slumped to a 61-run defeat on Sunday.

Deadly Bhubaneswar rooftop blast caught on camera, 2 die during treatmentInvestigators believe the explosion occurred while explosive materials were being handled on the rooftop. Gunpowder was recovered from the site, strengthening suspicions that crude bombs were being assembled there.

Man paid Rs 50,000 a year premium, insurance claim denied when mother fell illThe man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year for his mother's policy and when she needed treatment, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance, where he alleged he was made to wait for hours. His claim was denied.

Drop Babar, Shaheen, Shadab: Afridi goes on all-out rant after IND vs PAK lossT20 World Cup: Shahid Afridi has urged Pakistan to bench Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi and Shadab Khan after another heavy loss to India in Colombo. He wants youngsters trusted for the remaining T20 World Cup matches.

Bondi Beach shooter Naveed Akram appears in court, says just two wordsNaveed Akram, the surviving Bondi Beach terrorist, appeared before a court for the first time. Naveed and his father Sajid Akram, who had decades ago migrated from Hyderabad, shot dead 15 people on December 14, which was one of Australia's deadliest terror attacks. In court, Naveed said just two words.

In 2026 India, is Mysore silk saree the Birkin people queue up for at 4 am?Handcrafted ByOur Editors If you're someone who keeps track of viral videos, you would, by no means, have missed the clip of women queuing outside a store in Bengaluru at 4 am for a Mysore silk saree. But what's causing the demand? Has it gained a Birkin-like status among Indians?

North Korea's next ruler? Showdown between Kim Jong un's daughter vs auntSouth Korean intelligence suggests Kim Jong-un may be grooming his daughter Kim Ju-ae as successor. Experts warn this could spark a family power struggle, with Kim Yo-jong also eyeing the top post.

Ex-Pakistan spinner mocks IND vs PAK Colombo rout: Boycott would have been betterT20 World Cup: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria mocked Pakistan's humiliating 61-run loss to India in Colombo. Kaneria suggested a boycott would have been less embarrassing as Pakistan's Super 8 hopes now hang by a thread.

Why the Rafale buy mattersThe IAF needs the 114 jets to bolster its falling squadron numbers— it has just 29 fighter squadrons against a sanctioned strength of 42, even as adversaries Pakistan and China are bolstering their air forces.

Why do National Film Awards ignore casting? The Mukesh Chhabra interview | Part IWhy is casting still absent from the National Film Awards? In this multi-interview series, starting with Mukesh Chhabra, India Today reflects on India's casting ecosystem and why recognition now feels overdue. As the industry evolves, we try to turn the spotlight on a category that policymakers may no longer be able to overlook.

Baloch rebels capture 7 Pak soldiers, issues ultimatum for prisoner swapA video purportedly released alongside the claim shows at least seven men in Pakistan military uniform on their knees while armed gunmen from BLA surround them. The Baloch Liberation Army said the soldiers were taken into custody and a seven-day ultimatum had been issued for a potential prisoner exchange.

Bihar woman slaps daughter in public, forces her to carry bricks in school bagIn a video of the incident that has now gone viral on social media, the woman is seen scolding and repeatedly slapping the girl in public.

3rd time lucky? Madhya Pradesh IAS officer marries again, new bride also bureaucratMadhya Pradesh cadre IAS officer Avi Prasad's earlier marriages were to IAS officers Riju Bafna, currently posted as Collector of Shajapur, and Misha Singh, now Collector of Ratlam.

Live video: Kilauea volcano explodes with non-stop lava fountainsSince late 2024, Klauea has unleashed 42 episodic fountaining events, each typically lasting a day or less, separated by recharging pauses like the recent 19-day lull after Episode 41.

Mani Shankar Aiyar says Pinarayi Vijayan will be Kerala CM again. Congress reactsThe veteran Congress leader's comments came at a time when his party is leaving no stone unturned to come back to power.

Heartbroken Pakistan fan smashes TV after humbling loss to India in ColomboT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: A heartbroken Pakistan supporter was filmed smashing his television set following the team's crushing 61-run defeat to India in Colombo. He was just one of millions left reeling after Sunday's humbling at the hands of their arch-rivals.

Don't politicise national security: Kiren Rijiju to Rahul Gandhi from China borderStanding near one of the flashpoints of the 2020 Galwan clash along the India-China border, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said Rahul Gandhi should first learn about the borders and refrain from politicising issues of national security.

Marriage at 29, shared salaries and second chances mark India's matrimony resetA lot has changed between 2016 and 2025 in India's matchmaking landscape. A new report by matrimonial platform Jeevansathi highlights these major shifts.

Why the sky is blue, and sunsets turn it redThis new series from India Today Science explores the why and how behind everyday phenomena we notice, question, and often overlook. Each edition breaks down the science behind familiar experiences in simple terms. Today, we examine why the sky changes its colours at different times of the day.

Toddler drowns in water-filled pit month after techie died in similar incidentWhile playing near the community feast venue in Greater Noida, the 3 year-old Devansh reportedly slipped and fell into a deep pit filled with rainwater. Family members and villagers rushed to rescue him, but by the time he was pulled out, he had already died. Shocking reminder of Noida techie's death in a similar incident.

Why staying too long in one company may be costing employeesCompanies across India are paying new hires significantly higher salaries than existing employees. This growing pay gap challenges traditional loyalty and pushes professionals to reconsider their career strategies.

sports.headline: Unable to digest defeat, Mohsin Naqvi leaves stadium midway through chase As Pakistan's middle-order collapsed against India in Colombo, Mohsin Naqvi decided to leave the stadium mid-way through the chase. India dominated Pakistan to secure a thumping 61-run win on Sunday, February 15.

Ex-Pakistan spinner mocks IND vs PAK Colombo rout: Boycott would have been better T20 World Cup: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria mocked Pakistan's humiliating 61-run loss to India in Colombo. Kaneria suggested a boycott would have been less embarrassing as Pakistan's Super 8 hopes now hang by a thread.

Afghanistan vs UAE Live: Omarzai's double strike leaves UAE reeling Afghanistan (AFG) vs UAE (UAE) Live Score, T20 World Cup: UAE (123/6 in 16 ov) Mujeeb ur Rahman has dismissed Alishan Sharafu to end the 84-run partnership along with Sohaib Khan.

Like Kohli in Melbourne, Ishan Kishan finds cricket's loneliest place in Colombo T20 World Cup 2026: In Colombo against Pakistan, Ishan Kishan found cricket's loneliest place, the same space Virat Kohli once inhabited in Melbourne, but reached it through dominance rather than endurance.

India's C team will thrash Pakistan: Srikkanth calls for end of greatest rivalry hype T20 World Cup: After Pakistan's surrender to India during the T20 World Cup 2026, Kris Srikkanth said that the Indian C team is enough to beat the arch-rivals. Srikkanth heavily criticised the Pakistan batting after the heavy defeat in Colombo.

A new low: When Pakistan lost to India as early as toss. Over and out. T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Pakistan had little go their way after choosing to bowl first in Colombo, where teams batting second have struggled throughout the tournament. Their decision backfired as Pakistan slumped to a 61-run defeat on Sunday.

Has Babar Azam ever played a Kohli-esque knock? Irfan Pathan slams PAK batter T20 World Cup: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has slammed Babar Azam after another flopshow against India, asking if he has ever played a knock like Virat Kohli in a pressure game. Babar was dismissed for five runs in Colombo.

Drop Babar, Shaheen, Shadab: Afridi goes on all-out rant after IND vs PAK loss T20 World Cup: Shahid Afridi has urged Pakistan to bench Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi and Shadab Khan after another heavy loss to India in Colombo. He wants youngsters trusted for the remaining T20 World Cup matches.

Abhishek Sharma gets key advice from Shastri on form revival after PAK failure T20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma was given key advice on how to turn his form around as his recent slump in form continued during the India vs Pakistan game on Sunday, February 15. Abhishek was dismissed for a duck during the match in Colombo.

Watch: Rohit Sharma hugs Pakistan legend Wasim Akram in Colombo T20 World Cup: Former India captain Rohit Sharma shared a warm hug with Pakistan legend Wasim Akram during the pre-match ceremony in Colombo. The moment went viral ahead of India's dominant 61-run win over Pakistan.

Incompetent, ignorant: Akhtar tears into PCB chief after India hammers Pak IND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar launched a scathing attack on PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi and senior players after Pakistan's 61-run loss to India, calling incompetent leadership "the biggest crime in the world."

Do Pakistan deserve arch-rivals tag? Axar rubs salt into wounds after Colombo winT20 World Cup, India vs Pakistan: Star Indian all-rounder Axar Patel added to Pakistan's misery after the comprehensive 61-run win over the Salman Ali Agha-led side, playing down the hype around the rivalry between the two teams.

Matchday Preview: Struggling Australia look to breathe life into their campaignT20 World Cup: Day 10 of the tournament features crucial clashes in Delhi, Kolkata and Pallekele as Afghanistan face UAE, England meet Italy and Australia take on Sri Lanka in matches that could shape the Super 8 race.

IND vs PAK: Axar Patel focused on being a team man, not stressed about changing rolesHere is the full transcript of India all-rounder Axar Patel's press conference after their 61-run loss to India in the Group A clash in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup in Colombo.

Pakistan no match for India in skill and temperament: Sunil GavaskarT20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to India Today after India's 61-run victory in Colombo, legendary Sunil Gavaskar highlighted the gulf in skill and temperament between the two sides. He also heaped praise on Ishan Kishan for his superb 77 off 40 balls, noting that the innings effectively took the game away from Pakistan on Sunday.

Fearless Ishan Kishan took the game away from Pakistan: Pak coach Mike HessonIndia vs Pakistan, ICC T20 World Cup: Pakistan head coach Mike Hesson said it was Ishan Kishan's counter-attacking knock, rather than the top-order collapse, that proved to be the difference between the two sides in Pakistan's 61-run defeat to India in Colombo.

Heartbroken Pakistan fan smashes TV after humbling loss to India in ColomboT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: A heartbroken Pakistan supporter was filmed smashing his television set following the team's crushing 61-run defeat to India in Colombo. He was just one of millions left reeling after Sunday's humbling at the hands of their arch-rivals.

Time's up for Babar, Shaheen: Ex-captain slams Pakistan stars after India lossFormer Pakistan captain Mohammad Yousuf has launched a scathing attack on the team's senior core after Pakistan's crushing 61-run defeat to India in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 in Colombo, declaring that it is "time's up" for Babar Azam, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Shadab Khan.

This is for India: Surya after crushing Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2026IND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav dedicated their 61-run win over Pakistan to his nation, India. Ishan Kishan's 77 and Jasprit Bumrah's brilliance powered India to the Super Eight stage in Colombo on Sunday.

Why was Usman Tariq held back against India? Coach clarifies surprise moveT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Pakistan coach Mike Hesson explained why Usman Tariq was held back during the match against India. On Sunday, Pakistan suffered a 61-run defeat, with Tariq returning figures of 4-0-24-1.

Watch: Irfan Pathan dances to 'Afghan Jalebi' to troll Pakistan after India's winFormer India all-rounder Irfan Pathan trolled Pakistan by sharing a video of himself dancing to the popular track 'Afghan Jalebi' after India's comprehensive 61-run win in the Group A clash in Colombo.

Pakistan in danger of early T20 World Cup exit. Can it really happen?T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Salman Agha's Pakistan are in danger of an early exit from the tournament following their 61-run defeat to Suryakumar Yadav's India on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

No surprise: India steamroll predictably poor Pakistan to march into Super 8sIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup 2026: India hammered a predictably poor Pakistan by 61 runs to storm into the Super 8s stage. Handing Pakistan their biggest defeat in T20i head-to-head, India aced the battle of spin in Colombo on Sunday, February 15.

Babar Azam's nightmare vs India continues after yet another failure in T20 World CupT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Babar Azam scored five runs off seven balls before Axar Patel accounted for his wicket in the Group A clash on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo

Usman Tariq outfoxes Suryakumar Yadav, gives India captain cheeky send-offIndia vs Pakistan, T20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan's Usman Tariq delivered a cheeky send-off to India's captain, Suryakumar Yadav following the latter's dismissal.

India's 12th man: Shaheen Afridi trolled after expensive spell in ColomboT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Fast bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi was brutally trolled after his spell of 2-0-31-1 against India in the Group A clash on Sunday, February 15 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

Devdutt Padikkal puts hands up for India Test No.3 with stunning Ranji semis centuryRanji Trophy 2025-26: Devdutt Padikkal scored 148 off 236 balls against Uttarakhand, guiding Karnataka to a commanding 355 for two at stumps on Day 1 at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

Fearless Ishan Kishan decimates Pakistan's spin ploy, hits 40-ball 77 in ColomboT20 World Cup, India vs Pakistan: Ishan Kishan on Sunday credited his improved off-side play for his match-winning effort against arch-rivals Pakistan in the T20 World Cup. Kishan's 77 off 40 balls on a challenging surface proved decisive as India sealed a comfortable 61-run win.

Pakistan pull off Salman Agha masterstroke to dismiss Abhishek SharmaT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Salman Agha took the big wicket of Abhishek Sharma after opening the bowling for Pakistan in the marquee clash on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

IND vs PAK Playing XIs: Abhishek Sharma returns for India, Arshdeep Singh benchedIndia vs Pakistan, T20 World Cup: The Men in Blue have made two changes to their side, with Abhishek Sharma returning to the side. In addition, India has gone with a spin-heavy bowling unit by bringing in Kuldeep Yadav instead of Arshdeep Singh.

Suryakumar Yadav avoids shaking hands with Pakistan captain at tossICC T20 World Cup, India vs Pakistan: India captain Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha did not shake hands during the toss of their T20 World Cup 2026 clash in Colombo on Sunday, as India continued its no-handshake policy against Pakistan.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
